stories.text: Looking back in history lot of monumental changes occurred when someone clearly put an idea into words and shared with the world. Usually referred to as "Essay of ..." or "Papers on theory...". Reddit is too reactive, I want a place where people can post long observations, thoughts, opinions but without them or site getting into any legal trouble. Complete freedom of speech. Could be about criticizing govts, hate speech, alternative science theories, anything... I know it'd suck. But I find it hard to make the site "the place" without accepting the crap.
stories.title: Is it possible to create a site where users can anonymous post thoughts/essay?

stories.text: When commenting on colleague's work, or when arguing constructively, how often do you use "I think" in an attempt to appear less authoritarian/harsh, or conversely, more open minded. How did it work out? What are the pros and cons that you've observed?
stories.title: Ask HN: How often do you use “I think”?
